exceptions.exn: In environment pr : protocol I : dstatelet -> pred nid -> Prop ii : InductiveInv pr I z : nid s1, s2 : state H : network_rely (mkWorld (ProtocolWithIndInv ii)) z s1 s2 Unable to unify "s2" with "s1".

chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
pr: protocol
I: dstatelet -> pred nid -> Prop
ii: InductiveInv pr I
z: nid
s2: state
s1: state

Goal:
network_rely (mkWorld (ProtocolWithIndInv ii)) z s1 s2 -> network_rely (mkWorld pr) z s1 s2

Premises:
network_rely = fun (w : world) (this : nid) (s1 s2 : state) => exists n : nat, network_rely' w this n s1 s2 : world -> nid -> state -> state -> Prop
pred = fun T : Type => T -> bool : Type -> Type Arguments pred _%type_scope
Record dstatelet : Type := DStatelet { dstate : lstate_type heap; dsoup : soup }
mkWorld = fun p : protocol => (plab p \\-> p, Unit) : protocol -> world
InductiveInv = ProtocolWithInvariant.InductiveInv : protocol -> (dstatelet -> pred nid -> Prop) -> Type Arguments InductiveInv _ _%function_scope
nid = nat : Set
ProtocolWithIndInv : forall (p : protocol) (I : dstatelet -> pred nid -> Prop), ProtocolWithInvariant.InductiveInv p I -> Protocols.protocol
with_inv_step : forall (pr : protocol) (I : dstatelet -> pred nid -> Prop) (ii : InductiveInv pr I) (z : nid) (s1 s2 : state), s1 \In Coh (mkWorld (ProtocolWithIndInv ii)) -> network_step (mkWorld pr) z s1 s2 -> network_step (mkWorld (ProtocolWithIndInv ii)) z s1 s2
with_inv_step' : forall (pr : protocol) (I : dstatelet -> pred nid -> Prop) (ii : InductiveInv pr I) (z : nid) (s1 s2 : state), network_step (mkWorld (ProtocolWithIndInv ii)) z s1 s2 -> network_step (mkWorld pr) z s1 s2
with_inv_coh : forall (pr : protocol) (I : dstatelet -> pred nid -> Prop) (ii : InductiveInv pr I) (s : state), s \In Coh (mkWorld (ProtocolWithIndInv ii)) -> s \In Coh (mkWorld pr)
with_inv_nodes : forall (pr : protocol) (I : dstatelet -> pred nid -> Prop) (ii : InductiveInv pr I) (l : Label), nodes (getProtocol (mkWorld (ProtocolWithIndInv ii)) l) = nodes (getProtocol (mkWorld pr) l)
Mem_map_inv : ?x \In [seq ?f i | i <- ?s] -> exists y : ?T, ?x = ?f y /\ y \In ?s where ?T : [pr : protocol I : dstatelet -> pred nid -> Prop ii : InductiveInv pr I z : nid s1 : state s2 : state |- Type] ?T' : [pr : protocol I : dstatelet -> pred nid -> Prop ii : InductiveInv pr I z : nid s1 : state s2 : state |- Type] ?f : [pr : protocol I : dstatelet -> pred nid -> Prop ii : InductiveInv pr I z : nid s1 : state s2 : state |- ?T -> ?T'] ?x : [pr : protocol I : dstatelet -> pred nid ->...-> Prop ii : InductiveInv pr I z : nid s1 : state s2 : state |- seq ?T]
FunctionalExtensionality.functional_extensionality : forall f g : ?A -> ?B, (forall x : ?A, f x = g x) -> f = g where ?A : [pr : protocol I : dstatelet -> pred nid -> Prop ii : InductiveInv pr I z : nid s1 : state s2 : state |- Type] ?B : [pr : protocol I : dstatelet -> pred nid -> Prop ii : InductiveInv pr I z : nid s1 : state s2 : state |- Type]
getInvSendTrans : forall (p : protocol) (I : dstatelet -> pred nid -> Prop) (ii : ProtocolWithInvariant.InductiveInv p I) (st : send_trans (Protocols.coh (ProtocolWithIndInv ii))) (z to : nid) (msg : seq nat) (s1 : state) (h : heap), st \In snd_trans (ProtocolWithIndInv ii) -> forall S : send_safe st z to (getStatelet s1 (plab p)) msg, Some h = send_step S -> exists st' : send_trans (Protocols.coh (getProtocol (mkWorld p) (plab p))), [/\ st' \In get_st (mkWorld p) (plab p), t_snd st' = t_snd st, all_hooks_fire (mkWorld p) (plab p) (t_snd st') s1 z msg to & exists S' : send_safe st' z to (getStatelet s1 (plab p)) msg, Some h = send_step S']
rely_trans : forall (w : world) (this : nid) (s1 s2 s3 : state), network_rely w this s1 s2 -> network_rely w this s2 s3 -> network_rely w this s1 s3
step_is_local : forall (w : world) (this : nid) (s1 s2 : state) (l : Label), network_step w this s1 s2 -> forall z : nat_eqType, z != this -> find z (dstate (getStatelet s1 l)) = find z (dstate (getStatelet s2 l))
rely_coh : forall (w : world) (this : nid) (s1 s2 : state), network_rely w this s1 s2 -> Coh w s1 /\ Coh w s2
with_inv_labE : forall (pr : protocol) (I : dstatelet -> pred nid -> Prop) (ii : InductiveInv pr I), plab (ProtocolWithIndInv ii) = plab pr
rely_loc : forall (w : world) (this : nid) (s1 s2 : state) (l : Label), network_rely w this s1 s2 -> find this (dstate (getStatelet s1 l)) = find this (dstate (getStatelet s2 l))
network_rely' = fun (w : world) (this : nid) => fix network_rely' (n : nat) (s1 s2 : state) {struct n} : Prop := match n with | 0 => s1 = s2 /\ s1 \In Coh w | n'.+1 => exists (z : nat_eqType) (s3 : state), [/\ this != z, network_step w z s1 s3 & network_rely' n' s3 s2] end : world -> nid -> nat -> state -> state -> Prop Arguments network_rely' _ _ _%nat_scope
Idle : forall (w : world) (this : nid) (s1 s2 : state), s1 \In Coh w /\ s1 = s2 -> network_step w this s1 s2
stepV1 : forall (w : world) (this : nid) (s1 s2 : state), network_step w this s1 s2 -> valid s1
step_preserves_node_ids : forall (w : world) (this : nid) (s1 : union_mapUMC Label dstatelet) (s2 : state) (l : Label), l \in dom s1 -> network_step w this s1 s2 -> dom (dstate (getStatelet s1 l)) =i dom (dstate (getStatelet s2 l))
SendMsg : forall (w : world) (this : nid) (s1 s2 : state) (l : Label) (st : send_trans (Protocols.coh (getProtocol w l))), st \In get_st w l -> forall (to : nid) (msg : seq nat) (b : heap), this \in nodes (getProtocol w l) (getStatelet s1 l) -> l \in dom s1 -> Coh w s1 -> forall S : send_safe st this to (getStatelet s1 l) msg, all_hooks_fire w l (t_snd st) s1 this msg to -> Some b = send_step S -> s2 = upd l {| dstate := upd this b (dstate (getStatelet s1 l)); dsoup := (post_msg (dsoup (getStatelet s1 l)) {| content := {| tag := t_snd st; tms_cont := msg |}; from := this; to := to; active := true |}).1 |} s1 -> network_step w this s1 s2
rely_coh' : forall (w : world) (this : nid) (n : nat) (s1 s2 : state), network_rely' w this n s1 s2 -> Coh w s1 /\ Coh w s2
Inductive network_step (w : world) (this : nid) (s1 s2 : state) : Prop := Idle : s1 \In Coh w /\ s1 = s2 -> network_step w this s1 s2 | SendMsg : forall (l : Label) (st : send_trans (Protocols.coh (getProtocol w l))), st \In get_st w l -> forall (to : nid) (msg : seq nat) (b : heap), this \in nodes (getProtocol w l) (getStatelet s1 l) -> l \in dom s1 -> Coh w s1 ->...-> network_step w this s1 s2 Arguments Idle [w] _ [s1 s2] Arguments SendMsg [w this s1 s2 l st] _ [to] [msg]%seq_scope [b] _ _ _ [S] Arguments ReceiveMsg [w this s1 s2 l rt] _ [i] [from]%nat_scope [pf] _ [C msg0]
network_step_ind : forall (w : world) (this : nid) (s1 s2 : state) (P : Prop), (s1 \In Coh w /\ s1 = s2 -> P) ->...-> P
network_step_sind : forall (w : world) (this : nid) (s1 s2 : state) (P : SProp), (s1 \In Coh w /\ s1 = s2 -> P) ->...-> P
CohUn : forall (w1 w2 : world) (s1 s2 : state), Coh w1 s1 -> Coh w2 s2 -> valid (w1 \+ w2) -> Coh (w1 \+ w2) (s1 \+ s2)
ReceiveMsg : forall (w : world) (this : nid) (s1 s2 : state) (l : Label) (rt : receive_trans (Protocols.coh (getProtocol w l))), rt \In get_rt w l -> forall (i : mid) (from : nat) (pf : this \in nodes (getProtocol w l) (getStatelet s1 l)), l \in dom s1 -> forall (C : Coh w s1) (msg0 : TaggedMessage), tag msg0 = t_rcv rt ->...-> network_step w this s1 s2
ReceiveInv = ProtocolWithInvariant.ReceiveInv : protocol -> (dstatelet -> pred nid -> Prop) -> Type Arguments ReceiveInv _ _%function_scope
SendInv = ProtocolWithInvariant.SendInv : protocol -> (dstatelet -> pred nid -> Prop) -> Type Arguments SendInv _ _%function_scope
cohI = fun (p : protocol) (I : dstatelet -> pred nid -> Prop) => [Pred d | coh p d /\ I d (nodes p d)] : protocol -> (dstatelet -> pred nid -> Prop) -> Simpl_Pred dstatelet Arguments cohI _ _%function_scope
rely_refl : forall (w : world) (this : nid) (s : state), s \In Coh w -> network_rely w this s s
rtIn : forall (p : protocol) (I : dstatelet -> pred nid -> Prop) (ii : ProtocolWithInvariant.InductiveInv p I) (r : ProtocolWithInvariant.ReceiveInv p I), r \In rts ii -> rcv_transI (rt_inv (r:=r)) \In rcv_trans (ProtocolWithIndInv ii)
stIn : forall (p : protocol) (I : dstatelet -> pred nid -> Prop) (ii : ProtocolWithInvariant.InductiveInv p I) (s : ProtocolWithInvariant.SendInv p I), s \In sts ii -> snd_transI (st_inv (s:=s)) \In snd_trans (ProtocolWithIndInv ii)
send_safeI : forall p : protocol, (dstatelet -> pred nid -> Prop) -> send_trans (coh p) -> nid -> nid -> dstatelet -> seq nat -> Prop
